flawed_nl_solution:
After 30 days, there will be enough food left to sustain 300 people for 90 days - 30 days = 60 days.
After the 100 people leave, there will be 300-100 = <<300-100=200>>200 people left.
The 200 people will eat 200/300 = 2/2 as much food as the original group of people in the castle.
The 60 days' worth of food will last this smaller group for 60 days / (2/2) = <<60/(2/2)=60>>60 more days.
#### 60

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 200/300, not 2/2. It appears there was an off-by-one error in the fraction.
